H0.text: Oceans contain most of Earth’s fresh (non‑salty) water.

H1.text: Rivers contain most of the Earth's fresh (non-salty) water.

H2.text: Lakes contain the most fresh (non-salty) water on Earth.

H3.text: Polar ice caps contain the most fresh (non‑salty) water on Earth.

A4.text: The Antarctic ice sheet contains 26.5 million cubic kilometres of ice, which is equivalent to 61% of all fresh water on Earth.

A5.text: This ice is equivalent to around 61% of all fresh water on Earth.
